resources.string: "Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."
Must be the same as password

Your current balance may be different from your last statement balance, depending on what you\'ve spent since your last statement period. Be sure to review your transaction history and keep track of your spending to monitor your credit limit.
Paying your balance off in full and by the due date can ensure that you do not pay any interest or fees.
Statement balances not paid by the due date will incur interest the rate specified in your Cardholder agreement
Payments made after the due date can incur late fees upto $25
Paying less than the minimum due or paying after your due date may result in negative credit bureau reporting
Returned payments will have a fee upto $35 and your financial institution may charge additional fees
Your Minimum Payment Amount and Monthly Statement Balance will vary each month due to your card usage. For your reference, your last statement balance was $350.
